Lab Testing (Continued)

  1. Unfractionated anti-factor Xa
    • -Measured in units/mL of plasma
    • -Indicates heparin presence
      • Best measure of heparin presence in the septic pt.
    • -Some centers using this exclusively!!
    • -High levels of bilirubin, triglycerides, and/or plasma hemoglobin can interfere with measurement

Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time versus Antifactor Xa Heparin Assay in Monitoring Unfractionated Heparin by Continuous Intravenous Infusion

David J Guervil, Amy F Rosenberg, Almut G Winterstein, Neil S Harris, Thomas E Johns, Marc S Zumberg
The Annals of Pharmacotherapy. 2011;45(8):861-868.

  1. Anti-Thrombin III
    • -Measured in %
      • Body’s natural anticoagulant
      • Seeks out thrombin
      • Function increased more than 1000 fold in the presence of heparin
    • -1 ml of FFP contains approximately 1 unit of human AT

Next, let's answer a review question.
